h2. FFMpeg

A DSL for building and executing ffmpeg commands.

h2. Requirements

It requires that you already have ffmpeg installed, obviously :)

h2. Install

gem install polly-ffmpeg —source gems.github.com

h2. Usage

To build and execute a command you would use the FFMpeg::convert method and then call the FFMpeg::run method like this:

require "rubygems" require "ffmpeg" include FFMpeg

convert "file.ext", :to => "new_file.ext" do <span>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;seek "00:01:13"</span> <span>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;duration "00:10:01"</span> end.run

If you want the output file to have tha same name as the input file it‘s enough to just specify the new file extension like this:

require "rubygems" require "ffmpeg" include FFMpeg

convert "finding_that_nemo_dude.avi", :to => :flv do <span>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;…</span> end

This will produce an output file called finding_that_nemo_dude.flv

For more information checkout the "documentation":polly.github.com/ffmpeg/ or my "blog":pastbedti.me/

h2. Credit where credit‘s due

Thank‘s to "jwthompson2":github.com/jwthompson2, there‘s now support for all of the standard video and audio options from the ffmpeg documentation as well as improved and refactored specs.
